name: reclose
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to close again after being open, or to cause something to do this: Tests showed that his artery had re-closed. He placed the bottle back in the cabinet gently and reclosed the doors.
More examplesFewer examplesAny air should be expelled by compressing the container before reclosing.As soon as they forced their way in, they reclosed the door to keep out the crowd.The artery, which had been opened during surgery, had partially reclosed.
